name: samesurf/Actual Worlds
tag_list: co-browsing, public-rooms, real-time-sharing, online-support, collaborative-shopping, screen-sharing, audio-and-video-chat, shared-browsing
overview:
Samesurf is a platform technology, desktop and mobile app and collection of enabled sites that empower multiple users to share their browsing experiences in real-time without requiring installs of any kind. Our products fuse patent-pending co-browsing technology with features like HD audio & video chat, screen drawing and social integration to seamlessly recreate the feeling of “being together in real life.” Samesurf’s brand of shared browsing transforms online sharing into a fast and fully interactive experience that transcends alternatives like screen sharing in terms of simplicity, security and performance.

Our vision is to make distance forgettable by enabling instant sharing from any browser or device in a manner that will fundamentally change the ways we browse, shop, watch, listen, learn, present, meet, discover, study and work together online. For individuals, samesurf enables multiple users to shop, watch videos and browse the entire web together in real-time. For professionals, our offerings provide for an install free platform for meetings, presentations and collaboration. For publishers, samesurf provides visual context to support, sales and real-time sharing experiences by integrating features such as co-browsing, live chat, mouse tracking, screen drawing, desktop sharing, field masking, SSL encryption and audio & video chat. Within this context, our solutions significantly improve user satisfaction, first contact resolution and upsell opportunities on the support and sales side while increasing conversions, time on site and highly targeted traffic for activities like real-time sharing and collaborative shopping.

Samesurf/Actual Worlds, Inc. was co-founded by CEO K. David Pirnazar and Sapient co-founder Jerry A. Greenberg in January 2009. The company’s integrated partners include Sapient (NASDAQ: SAPE) and LivePerson (NASDAQ: LPSN) while it investors include Omninet Capital (established by co-founders of Qualcomm - NASDAQ: QCOM).
